oaidtb.boosters
Class Booster

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--weka.classifiers.Classifier
        |
        +--weka.classifiers.DistributionClassifier
              |
              +--oaidtb.boosters.Booster
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, IterativeUpdatableClassifier, weka.core.OptionHandler, java.io.Serializable, weka.core.WeightedInstancesHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractCSB, AdaBoostM1, AdaBoostOC, GentleAdaBoost, RealAdaBoost
public abstract class Booster
extends weka.classifiers.DistributionClassifier
implements weka.core.OptionHandler, weka.core.WeightedInstancesHandler, IterativeUpdatableClassifier

Abstract class defining the structure ("iterative & interactive") and common options to our boosting implementations. Partially based in "AdaBoostM1" weka class.

Version:
$Revision: 1.0 $
Author:
Santiago David Villalba Bartolomé
See Also:

listOptions

public java.util.Enumeration listOptions()
Returns an enumeration describing the available options
Specified by:
listOptions in interface weka.core.OptionHandler
Returns:
an enumeration of all the available options

setOptions

public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Parses a given list of options. Valid options are:

-D
Turn on debugging output.

-W classname
Specify the full class name of a classifier as the basis for boosting (required).

-I num
Set the number of boost iterations on first call to BuildClassifier (default 10).

-Q
Use resampling instead of reweighting.

-S seed
Random number seed for resampling (default 1).

-N normFactor
Normalization policy and factor; options: 


   - If <0  --> Sum of weights at each iteration will not be normalized
   - If ==0 --> Sum of weights at each iteration will be the original sum of weights in the training set
   - If >0  --> Sum of weights at each iteration will be normFactor
Options after -- are passed to the designated classifier.

Specified by:
setOptions in interface weka.core.OptionHandler
Parameters:
options - the list of options as an array of strings
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if an option is not supported

getOptions

public java.lang.String[] getOptions()

an array of strings suitable for passing to setOptions

setNormFactor

public void setNormFactor(double normFactor)
Set the normalization factor (and policy) which will be used; options: 

   - If <0  --> Sum of weights at each iteration will not be normalized
   - If ==0 --> Sum of weights at each iteration will be the original sum of weights in the training set
   - If >0  --> Sum of weights at each iteration will be normFactor
Parameters:
normFactor - Normalization policy indicator & sum of weights at each iteration if > 0

getNormFactor

public double getNormFactor()
Get the normalization factor used (ie. what will be the sum of weights after each iteration).
Returns:
The normalization factor.

secureSetWeight

protected final void secureSetWeight(weka.core.Instance instance,
                                     double weight)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Set the weight of an instance. When a mathematical exceptional value (NaN, Infinite) is passed as the value of the weight of an instance (i.e. Math.exp(Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY)) it probably will spoil the things. TODO: Set up a policy to deal with those values, centralize it in this method or in ad hoc methods for each afectable operation (exp, log...)
Parameters:
instance - The instance
weight - The weight
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If weight is an invalid value

purgeTraindata

public void purgeTraindata()
Free the memory reserved to the train dataset. WARNING: After a call to this function the booster will not be ready to perform more iterations.

purgeIterations

public void purgeIterations(int numIterations)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Eliminate the last numIterations performed from the final combined hypothesis.
  • Note: To free the memory allocated, this method must be overriden
  • Note: The weights distribution of the training instances will not return back in the time.
    Parameters:
    numIterations - The number of iterations to get rid of
    Throws:
    java.lang.Exception - If numIterations parameter is incorrect

    sortProperties

    public java.beans.PropertyDescriptor[] sortProperties(java.beans.PropertyDescriptor[] properties)
    Sorts the properties that will be shown in a customizedWeka.PropertySheetPanel, by default following the order defined by getPropertiesOrder(). It can be used for more ambitious purposes since it will be used instead of getPropertiesDescriptor there, so it will prevail even over an hypothetical customized BeanInfo class.
    Parameters:
    properties - The properties to be sort (commonly the own class properties).
    Returns:
    The properties sorted (or even changed) according to an specified criterion.
